article:
Cyclone Freddy

Cyclone Freddy was a powerful and long-lived tropical cyclone that affected several countries in the Indian Ocean and southeastern Africa in February and March 2023. The cyclone caused widespread destruction and loss of life in the Mascarene Islands, Madagascar, Mozambique, and Malawi, and its impact was felt in several other countries in the region.

# Meteorological history

Cyclone Freddy formed on February 5, 2023, as a tropical disturbance in the Indian Ocean, approximately 1,000 km (620 mi) northwest of Mauritius. The system gradually intensified as it moved westward, and on February 6, it was classified as a tropical depression by the Mauritius Meteorological Service. Over the next few days, the cyclone continued to strengthen, and on February 10, it was upgraded to a tropical cyclone by the Regional Specialized Meteorological Centre (RSMC) in Réunion.

Freddy continued to intensify as it approached the Mascarene Islands, and on February 12, it reached its peak intensity as a Category 5-equivalent cyclone, with maximum sustained winds of 275 km/h (170 mph) and a minimum central pressure of 925 hPa (27.32 inHg). The cyclone made landfall in Madagascar on February 14, and then moved westward, affecting Mozambique and Malawi.

## Records

Cyclone Freddy set several records during its lifetime. It was the longest-lived tropical cyclone in the Southern Hemisphere, lasting for 37 days. It was also the cyclone with the highest accumulated cyclone energy (ACE) in the Southern Hemisphere, with a total of 73.2 units. Additionally, Freddy was the strongest cyclone to affect the Mascarene Islands since Cyclone Hollanda in 1994.

# Preparations

Several countries in the region took precautions to prepare for the cyclone's arrival.

## Mauritius

The Mauritius Meteorological Service issued a cyclone warning on February 9, and the government declared a state of emergency on February 10. The airport was closed, and all flights were suspended. The government also ordered the evacuation of low-lying areas and the closure of all schools and universities.

## Réunion

The RSMC in Réunion issued a cyclone warning on February 10, and the government declared a state of emergency on February 11. The airport was closed, and all flights were suspended. The government also ordered the evacuation of low-lying areas and the closure of all schools and universities.

## Madagascar

The Madagascar Meteorological Service issued a cyclone warning on February 11, and the government declared a state of emergency on February 12. The airport was closed, and all flights were suspended. The government also ordered the evacuation of low-lying areas and the closure of all schools and universities.

## Mozambique

The Mozambique Meteorological Service issued a cyclone warning on February 14, and the government declared a state of emergency on February 15. The airport was closed, and all flights were suspended. The government also ordered the evacuation of low-lying areas and the closure of all schools and universities.

## Malawi

The Malawi Meteorological Service issued a cyclone warning on February 16, and the government declared a state of emergency on February 17. The airport was closed, and all flights were suspended. The government also ordered the evacuation of low-lying areas and the closure of all schools and universities.

# Impact

Cyclone Freddy caused widespread destruction and loss of life in several countries in the region.

## Mascarene Islands

The cyclone caused significant damage to infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and buildings. The airport was closed, and all flights were suspended. The government reported that over 1,000 homes were destroyed, and over 5,000 people were left homeless.

## Madagascar

The cyclone caused widespread destruction, particularly in the eastern part of the country. Over 1,000 homes were destroyed, and over 10,000 people were left homeless. The government reported that at least 20 people were killed, and over 100 were injured.

## Mozambique

The cyclone caused significant damage to infrastructure, including roads, bridges, and buildings. Over 1,000 homes were destroyed, and over 5,000 people were left homeless. The government reported that at least 10 people were killed, and over 50 were injured.

## Malawi

The cyclone caused widespread destruction, particularly in the southern part of the country. Over 1,000 homes were destroyed, and over 5,000 people were left homeless. The government reported that at least 10 people were killed, and over 50 were injured.

## Elsewhere in mainland Africa

The cyclone also caused damage and disruption in several other countries in the region, including Tanzania, Zambia, and Zimbabwe.

# Aftermath

The aftermath of the cyclone saw a massive relief effort in several countries in the region.

## Madagascar

The government declared a state of emergency, and the military was deployed to assist with relief efforts. The international community provided significant support, including food, shelter, and medical aid.

## Mozambique

## Malawi

2023 Indonesia Masters

The 2023 Indonesia Masters was a badminton tournament that took place at the Istora Senayan in Jakarta, Indonesia, from January 10 to January 15, 2023. It was the first Super 500 tournament of the 2023 BWF World Tour and was part of the Indonesia Masters championships, which had been held since 2010.

# Tournament

## Venue

The 2023 Indonesia Masters was held at the Istora Senayan in Jakarta, Indonesia. The Istora Senayan is a multi-purpose indoor arena that has hosted numerous international badminton tournaments, including the Indonesia Open and the Southeast Asian Games.

The 2023 Indonesia Masters was a Super 500 tournament, which meant that it offered a higher number of points compared to Super 300 and Super 100 tournaments. The points distribution was as follows:

* Winner: 9,200 points

article:
2023 Hamburg Shooting

On March 9, 2023, a mass shooting occurred in Hamburg, Germany, resulting in one of the deadliest attacks in the country's recent history. The shooting took place in the afternoon at the Heimfeld district, a quiet residential area in the eastern part of Hamburg. The incident sent shockwaves throughout the country and sparked widespread outrage and condemnation.

#Shooting

The shooting occurred at approximately 2:45 pm local time at a Jehovah's Witnesses center on Deelböge Street in the Heimfeld district. The gunman, identified as a 35-year-old German national, entered the building and began firing indiscriminately at people inside. Witnesses reported hearing multiple shots and seeing people fleeing the scene in panic.

The police were quickly alerted, and a large-scale operation was launched to apprehend the suspect. Officers from the Hamburg State Police, along with SWAT teams and emergency services, rushed to the scene to contain the situation. The area was cordoned off, and nearby residents were evacuated as a precautionary measure.

According to eyewitness accounts, the shooter was seen wearing a black jacket and carrying a backpack. He reportedly acted alone and did not appear to have any accomplices. The motive behind the attack is still under investigation.

##Investigation

The Hamburg police launched a comprehensive investigation into the shooting, gathering evidence and conducting interviews with witnesses and potential suspects. Forensic experts were deployed to the scene to analyze the crime scene and identify any potential clues.

As part of the investigation, police searched the gunman's residence and seized several items, including his laptop and mobile phone. The authorities also reviewed CCTV footage and social media activity to piece together the events leading up to the attack.

#Casualties

The shooting resulted in seven fatalities and eight injuries, with several others left traumatized by the ordeal. The victims were mostly members of the Jehovah's Witnesses community, who had gathered at the center for a weekly meeting. The ages of the victims ranged from 33 to 60.

Among the injured were two police officers who were shot while attempting to apprehend the suspect. They were treated for non-life-threatening injuries and released from the hospital.

##Tributes

The shooting sent shockwaves throughout the community, with many expressing their condolences to the families of the victims. The Jehovah's Witnesses organization issued a statement condemning the attack and calling for peace and understanding.

Local residents and community leaders also paid tribute to the victims, laying flowers and candles at the scene of the crime. A vigil was held in the evening, with hundreds gathering to mourn the loss of life and offer support to the affected families.

#Perpetrator

The gunman, identified as Philipp F., was a 35-year-old German national with no known extremist affiliations. He was born and raised in Hamburg and had no prior convictions.

According to police, Philipp F. was a former member of the Jehovah's Witnesses community but had been expelled several years ago due to his increasingly erratic behavior. He had reportedly become isolated and withdrawn, with few friends or acquaintances.

##Mental Health

The investigation revealed that Philipp F. had a history of mental health issues, including depression and anxiety. He had been receiving treatment but had stopped attending therapy sessions several months prior to the attack.

The authorities also discovered that Philipp F. had been active on online forums, expressing his grievances against the Jehovah's Witnesses organization and its members. The content of these posts has not been publicly disclosed.

#Reactions

The shooting sparked widespread outrage and condemnation across Germany, with politicians and community leaders calling for increased security measures and greater support for mental health services.

##Government Response

The German government issued a statement condemning the attack and pledging to do everything in its power to prevent similar incidents in the future. The Interior Minister announced plans to increase security measures at places of worship and community centers.

##International Response

The international community also expressed its condolences to the families of the victims, with leaders from around the world condemning the attack and calling for greater unity and cooperation in the face of terrorism and extremism.

2023 All England Open

The 2023 All England Open, also known as the Yonex All England Open Badminton Championships, was a badminton tournament that took place from 14 to 19 March 2023 at the Utilita Arena Birmingham in Birmingham, England. The tournament was the 113th edition of the All England Open and was part of the 2023 BWF World Tour.

# Tournament

## Venue

The tournament was held at the Utilita Arena Birmingham, which has a seating capacity of over 15,000 spectators. The arena has hosted several high-profile badminton events in the past, including the 2010 BWF World Championships.

## Point distribution

The tournament was categorized as a Super 1000 event, which meant that the winners of each discipline received a significant number of points towards their world ranking. The point distribution for the tournament was as follows:

* Winner: 12,000 points
* Runner-up: 10,200 points
* Semi-finalist: 8,400 points
* Quarter-finalist: 6,600 points
* Round of 16: 4,800 points
* Round of 32: 3,000 points
* Round of 64: 1,200 points

## Prize pool

The total prize pool for the tournament was $1,200,000, which was distributed among the winners of each discipline.

# Men's singles

## Seeds

The top eight seeds in the men's singles discipline were:

1.  Viktor Axelson (Denmark)
2.  Kento Momota (Japan)
3.  Anders Antonsen (Denmark)

## Finals

The final match of the men's singles discipline was played between Viktor Axelson and Shi Yuqi. Axelson won the match 21-10, 21-14, claiming his third All England Open title.

## Top half

### Section 1

The top half of the men's singles draw featured several high-profile players, including Viktor Axelson and Kento Momota. Axelson defeated his first-round opponent, Ng Tze Yong, 21-12, 21-14, while Momota beat his opponent, Lakshya Sen, 21-15, 21-18.

### Section 2

In the second section of the top half, Anders Antonsen and Jonatan Christie were the top seeds. Antonsen defeated his first-round opponent, Wang Tzu-wei, 21-19, 21-15, while Christie beat his opponent, Li Shi Feng, 21-13, 21-14.

## Bottom half

article:
2022 National League Championship Series

The 2022 National League Championship Series (NLCS) was the best-of-seven game championship series in Major League Baseball (MLB) for the 2022 postseason. The series was played between the Philadelphia Phillies, champions of the National League East division, and the San Diego Padres, champions of the National League West division. The series began on October 18, 2022, and ended on October 23, 2022.

#Background

The Philadelphia Phillies entered the 2022 NLCS as the third seed in the National League, having won the National League East division title with a record of 87-75. The Phillies were led by manager Rob Thomson, who took over the team in June 2022 after the firing of Joe Girardi. The team was powered by a strong offense, led by Bryce Harper, Kyle Schwarber, and Rhys Hoskins, as well as a solid pitching staff anchored by Zack Wheeler and Aaron Nola.

The San Diego Padres entered the 2022 NLCS as the fifth seed in the National League, having won the National League West division title with a record of 89-73. The Padres were led by manager Bob Melvin, who was in his first season with the team. The team was led by a strong pitching staff, anchored by Yu Darvish and Blake Snell, as well as a solid offense led by Juan Soto and Manny Machado.

#Summary

The Philadelphia Phillies won the series 4 games to 1, advancing to the World Series for the first time since 2009. The series was marked by strong pitching performances from both teams, as well as timely hitting from the Phillies' offense. The Phillies' victory marked their sixth National League pennant in franchise history.

#Game summaries

##Game 1

Game 1 of the series was played on October 18, 2022, at Petco Park in San Diego, California. The Phillies took an early lead, scoring two runs in the top of the first inning on a home run by Bryce Harper. The Padres tied the game in the bottom of the second inning on a sacrifice fly by Wil Myers. The game remained tied until the top of the seventh inning, when the Phillies scored three runs on a home run by Kyle Schwarber. The Phillies' bullpen held the lead, and the team won the game 6-3.

##Game 2

Game 2 of the series was played on October 19, 2022, at Petco Park in San Diego, California. The Padres took an early lead, scoring two runs in the bottom of the first inning on a home run by Juan Soto. The Phillies tied the game in the top of the third inning on a home run by Rhys Hoskins. The game remained tied until the bottom of the eighth inning, when the Padres scored the go-ahead run on a sacrifice fly by Ha-Seong Kim. The Padres' bullpen held the lead, and the team won the game 5-4.

##Game 3

Game 3 of the series was played on October 21, 2022, at Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The Phillies took an early lead, scoring two runs in the bottom of the first inning on a home run by Kyle Schwarber. The Padres tied the game in the top of the third inning on a home run by Manny Machado. The game remained tied until the bottom of the sixth inning, when the Phillies scored two runs on a home run by Bryce Harper. The Phillies' bullpen held the lead, and the team won the game 4-2.

##Game 4

Game 4 of the series was played on October 22, 2022, at Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The Phillies took an early lead, scoring four runs in the bottom of the first inning on home runs by Rhys Hoskins and Bryce Harper. The Padres scored two runs in the top of the fifth inning on a home run by Juan Soto. The Phillies' bullpen held the lead, and the team won the game 10-6.

##Game 5

Game 5 of the series was played on October 23, 2022, at Citizens Bank Park in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The Phillies took an early lead, scoring three runs in the bottom of the first inning on a home run by Kyle Schwarber. The Padres scored two runs in the top of the third inning on a home run by Manny Machado. The Phillies' bullpen held the lead, and the team won the game 4-3.

The Voice is an American singing competition television series that premiered on March 6, 2023, on NBC. The show features a competition among aspiring singers, with a unique blind audition format. **Overview**

article:
Croatia national football team

The Croatia national football team represents Croatia in international football competitions and is controlled by the Croatian Football Federation. The team has a rich history, having competed in several major tournaments, including the FIFA World Cup and the UEFA European Championship.

# History

## Official formation

The Croatia national football team was officially formed in 1991, following the country's independence from Yugoslavia. However, the team's origins date back to 1940, when a Croatian national team was formed during World War II. This team played several friendly matches against other national teams, but it was not recognized by FIFA.

## Blažević period (1994–1999)

The modern Croatia national team was formed in 1994, with Miroslav Blažević as its first manager. Blažević led the team to its first major tournament, the 1996 European Championship, where they were eliminated in the quarterfinals by Germany. The team also qualified for the 1998 FIFA World Cup, where they finished third, defeating the Netherlands 2-1 in the third-place playoff.

## Jozić, Barić and Kranjčar period (2000–2006)

After Blažević's departure, the team was managed by several coaches, including Mirko Jozić, Zlatko Kranjčar, and Otto Barić. During this period, the team qualified for the 2002 FIFA World Cup and the 2004 European Championship, but failed to advance beyond the group stage.

## Bilić period (2006–2012)

Slaven Bilić took over as manager in 2006 and led the team to the 2008 European Championship, where they were eliminated in the quarterfinals by Turkey. The team also qualified for the 2010 FIFA World Cup and the 2012 European Championship, but failed to advance beyond the group stage.

## Štimac, Kovač and Čačić period (2012–2017)

After Bilić's departure, the team was managed by Igor Štimac, Niko Kovač, and Ante Čačić. During this period, the team qualified for the 2014 FIFA World Cup and the 2016 European Championship, but failed to advance beyond the group stage.

## Dalić period (since 2017)

Zlatko Dalić took over as manager in 2017 and led the team to the 2018 FIFA World Cup, where they finished runners-up, losing to France in the final. The team also qualified for the 2020 European Championship, where they were eliminated in the round of 16 by Spain.

# Image

## Kits

The Croatia national team's kit is manufactured by Nike and features the country's national colors, red, white, and blue. The home kit is typically red and white checkered, while the away kit is blue.

## Supporters

The Croatia national team has a large and dedicated fan base, known as the "Vatreni" (The Fiery Ones). The fans are known for their passionate support and have been recognized for their sportsmanship and fair play.

## Charity

The Croatia national team has been involved in several charitable initiatives, including supporting children's hospitals and participating in fundraising campaigns for disaster relief.

# Stadiums

The Croatia national team plays its home matches at the Stadion Maksimir in Zagreb, which has a seating capacity of over 40,000. The team has also played at other stadiums in the country, including the Stadion Poljud in Split and the Stadion Kantrida in Rijeka.

article:
Atiq Ahmed

Atiq Ahmed is a notorious Indian politician and former Member of Parliament from the Samajwadi Party. He was a prominent figure in the Indian politics, particularly in the state of Uttar Pradesh, before his eventual downfall due to his involvement in several high-profile crimes.

# Early and personal life

Atiq Ahmed was born on August 10, 1962, in Allahabad, Uttar Pradesh, India. His early life was marked by poverty and struggle. Ahmed's father was a daily-wage laborer, and the family had to work hard to make ends meet. Despite the financial struggles, Ahmed's parents managed to send him to school, where he showed a keen interest in politics from an early age.

Ahmed's entry into politics was largely influenced by his brother, Khalid Azim alias Ashraf, who was already involved in local politics. Ashraf's connections with local politicians and his involvement in various social activities inspired Ahmed to follow in his footsteps.

# Political career

## Entry into politics

Atiq Ahmed's entry into politics was marked by his involvement in the Samajwadi Party, a prominent political party in Uttar Pradesh. He began his career as a local leader, working his way up the ranks by building relationships with local politicians and community leaders. Ahmed's charisma and oratory skills quickly made him a popular figure in local politics.

## As a member of Lok Sabha

Ahmed's big break came in 2004 when he was elected as a Member of Parliament from the Phulpur constituency in Uttar Pradesh. He was just 42 years old at the time and was seen as a rising star in the Samajwadi Party. During his tenure as an MP, Ahmed was known for his vocal support of the party's ideology and his involvement in various social causes.

## Participation from prison

Despite being involved in several high-profile crimes, Ahmed continued to participate in politics even from behind bars. In 2008, while he was lodged in a prison in Allahabad, Ahmed contested and won the Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly election from the Allahabad West constituency. His victory was seen as a testament to his enduring popularity in the region.

# Electoral history

* 2004: Elected as Member of Parliament from Phulpur constituency
* 2008: Elected as Member of Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly from Allahabad West constituency
* 2012: Lost the Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly election from Allahabad West constituency

# Criminal cases

Atiq Ahmed's involvement in crime dates back to the 1990s. He was initially involved in petty crimes, but soon graduated to more serious offenses.

## Introduction to crime

Ahmed's introduction to crime was largely influenced by his association with local gangsters and politicians. His involvement in crime began with extortion and intimidation, but soon he became involved in more serious crimes, including murder and kidnapping.

## Raju Pal murder

In 2005, Ahmed was accused of murdering Raju Pal, a local politician and businessman. Pal was a prominent figure in the Samajwadi Party and had been at odds with Ahmed over various issues. Ahmed was arrested and charged with Pal's murder, but he was later acquitted due to lack of evidence.

## SHUATS assault case

In 2018, Ahmed was accused of assaulting a professor at the Sam Higginbottom University of Agriculture, Technology and Sciences (SHUATS) in Allahabad. The professor had allegedly refused to give Ahmed's son admission to the university. Ahmed was arrested and charged with assault, but he was later released on bail.

## Umesh Pal abduction and murder

In 2023, Ahmed was accused of abducting and murdering Umesh Pal, a local businessman. Pal had been a witness in the Raju Pal murder case and had testified against Ahmed. Ahmed was arrested and charged with Pal's murder, but he died in police custody before he could be brought to trial.

# Death

Atiq Ahmed died on April 15, 2023, while in police custody. He was 60 years old at the time of his death. Ahmed's death was seen as a major blow to the Samajwadi Party, which had been struggling to revive its fortunes in Uttar Pradesh.

Joe Martin (orangutan)
=====================

Joe Martin was a male orangutan who gained widespread fame in the early 20th century for his performances in film and live shows. He was known for his remarkable intelligence, agility, and mischievous behavior, which often led to trouble and controversy. This article provides an overview of Joe Martin's life, career, and notable incidents.

Background
----------

Orangutans, native to Indonesia and Malaysia, are one of the most intelligent primates, known for their advanced problem-solving skills and adaptability. In the early 20th century, it was not uncommon for orangutans to be captured and brought to the United States for exhibition and entertainment purposes. Joe Martin was one such orangutan, who would go on to become a celebrated performer and a household name.

Biography
----------

### Transoceanic shipment and first owners

Joe Martin was born in the wild, likely in the jungles of Borneo or Sumatra. He was captured at a young age and shipped to the United States, where he was purchased by a wealthy businessman named Henry Trefflich. Trefflich, a collector of exotic animals, kept Joe Martin at his estate in New York, where he was cared for by a team of trainers and handlers.

### 1915–1917: Breakout film and early work

In 1915, Joe Martin made his film debut in a short comedy called "The Orang-Outang," which was produced by the Edison Manufacturing Company. The film was a surprise hit, and Joe Martin's antics on screen quickly made him a fan favorite. Over the next few years, he appeared in several more films, including "The Mischievous Orang-Outang" and "Joe Martin's Day Out."

### 1918: Influenza epidemic, and night-watchman incident

In 1918, the United States was hit by a devastating influenza epidemic, which claimed millions of lives. Joe Martin's owner, Henry Trefflich, was among those who fell ill, and the orangutan was left in the care of a night watchman named John Smith. One night, while Smith was on duty, Joe Martin managed to escape from his enclosure and roam freely around the estate. The incident caused a stir in the local community, and Joe Martin's reputation as a mischievous and cunning animal was solidified.

### 1919: Escapes and Al Santell incident

In 1919, Joe Martin was involved in two notable incidents. The first occurred when he escaped from his enclosure and climbed a tree on the estate, where he remained for several hours. The second incident involved a film director named Al Santell, who was working with Joe Martin on a new film project. According to reports, Joe Martin became agitated during filming and attacked Santell, causing him to sustain serious injuries.

### 1920: Tarzan incident

In 1920, Joe Martin was involved in a notorious incident with the famous actor Elmo Lincoln, who was starring in a film adaptation of Edgar Rice Burroughs' "Tarzan of the Apes." During filming, Joe Martin became agitated and attacked Lincoln, who was forced to flee the set. The incident was widely reported in the press, and Joe Martin's reputation as a volatile and unpredictable animal was further cemented.

### 1921: Continuing in show business, Ethel Stecker incident

Despite the controversy surrounding him, Joe Martin continued to work in show business, appearing in films and live shows throughout the United States. In 1921, he was involved in an incident with a woman named Ethel Stecker, who was working as a trainer and handler for Joe Martin's owner. According to reports, Joe Martin became aggressive towards Stecker and attacked her, causing her to sustain serious injuries.

### 1922–1923: Behavioral issues, death of Curley Stecker

In 1922 and 1923, Joe Martin's behavioral issues continued to cause problems for his owners and handlers. He was involved in several incidents, including a notable attack on a man named Curley Stecker, who was the brother of Ethel Stecker. Tragically, Curley Stecker died as a result of his injuries, and Joe Martin was widely condemned for his actions.

### 1923–1927: Barnes Circus and Barnes City Zoo

In 1923, Joe Martin was sold to the Barnes Circus, a traveling circus that was based in the United States. He spent several years with the circus, performing in live shows and exhibitions. In 1927, the Barnes Circus was sold to a new owner, who established the Barnes City Zoo in New York. Joe Martin was one of the main attractions at the zoo, where he was kept in a large enclosure and displayed to the public.

### 1928–1931: Last reports

The last reports of Joe Martin's life date back to the late 1920s and early 1930s. According to accounts, he continued to live at the Barnes City Zoo, where he was cared for by a team of trainers and handlers. However, his health began to decline, and he eventually passed away in 1931, at the age of around 20.

article:
Sonic the Hedgehog 2 (film)

Sonic the Hedgehog 2 is a 2022 comedy-adventure film directed by Jeff Fowler and written by Pat Casey, Josh Miller and John Whittington. The film is a sequel to the 2020 film Sonic the Hedgehog and is based on the video game franchise of the same name by Sega. The movie follows the story of Sonic, a blue anthropomorphic hedgehog, and his human friends as they face a new threat from the evil scientist Dr. Robotnik and his accomplice Knuckles.

#Plot

The film takes place after the events of the first movie, where Sonic (voiced by Ben Schwartz) has settled into his new life in Green Hills, Montana, with his human friends Tom (James Marsden) and Maddie (Tika Sumpter) Wachowski. However, Sonic's peaceful life is disrupted when Dr. Robotnik (Jim Carrey) returns from his exile on the mushroom planet with a new ally, Knuckles the Echidna (voiced by Idris Elba). Knuckles is a powerful and skilled fighter who seeks to protect the Master Emerald, a powerful ancient artifact that is hidden on Earth.

As Dr. Robotnik and Knuckles search for the Master Emerald, Sonic teams up with his old friend Tails (voiced by Colleen O'Shaughnessey), a two-tailed fox who is a skilled mechanic and pilot. Together, they embark on a quest to stop Dr. Robotnik and Knuckles, while also learning more about Sonic's past and his connection to the Master Emerald.

#Cast

##Voice cast

* Ben Schwartz as Sonic the Hedgehog
* Colleen O'Shaughnessey as Miles "Tails" Prower
* Idris Elba as Knuckles the Echidna
* Donna Jay Fulks as Longclaw

##Live-action cast

* James Marsden as Tom Wachowski
* Tika Sumpter as Maddie Wachowski
* Jim Carrey as Dr. Robotnik
* Shemar Moore as Randall Handel
* Lee Majdoub as Agent Stone

#Production

##Development

The development of Sonic the Hedgehog 2 began in May 2020, after the success of the first film. Paramount Pictures and Sega announced that a sequel was in the works, with Jeff Fowler set to return as director and Pat Casey, Josh Miller and John Whittington writing the script.

##Casting

The casting process for the film began in December 2020, with Ben Schwartz and James Marsden set to reprise their roles as Sonic and Tom Wachowski. In January 2021, it was announced that Idris Elba would be joining the cast as the voice of Knuckles. Colleen O'Shaughnessey was also cast as the voice of Tails, a character she has voiced in several Sonic video games.

##Filming, visual effects and animation

Principal photography for the film began on April 15, 2021, in Vancouver, British Columbia. The film was shot on a combination of practical and visual effects, with the animation and visual effects provided by Moving Picture Company (MPC) and Digital Domain.

##Music

The music for the film was composed by Tom Holkenborg, who also scored the first film. The score combines electronic and rock elements, with several themes and motifs inspired by the Sonic video game series.

#Release

##Marketing

The marketing campaign for Sonic the Hedgehog 2 began in December 2021, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer featured a brief glimpse of Knuckles and the Master Emerald, as well as several action-packed sequences featuring Sonic and Tails.

##Theatrical

Sonic the Hedgehog 2 was released in theaters on April 8, 2022, in the United States and on April 1, 2022, in the United Kingdom. The film was released in several formats, including IMAX and 3D.

##Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on May 24, 2022, and on DVD and Blu-ray on August 9, 2022.

#Reception

##Box office

Sonic the Hedgehog 2 was a commercial success, grossing over $395 million worldwide. The film performed well in several countries, including the United States, China and Japan.

##Critical response

The film received generally positive reviews from critics, with several praising the film's action sequences, visuals and performances. However, some critics felt that the film's plot was predictable and that the pacing was uneven.

##Accolades

Sonic the Hedgehog 2 was nominated for several awards, including the 2022 Teen Choice Awards and the 2022 Visual Effects Society Awards.

#Sequel

In May 2022, it was announced that a third Sonic film was in development, with Jeff Fowler set to return as director and Pat Casey, Josh Miller and John Whittington set to return as writers.

#See also

* Sonic the Hedgehog (film)
* Sonic the Hedgehog (video game series)
* Dr. Robotnik
* Knuckles the Echidna

#Notes

* Sonic the Hedgehog 2 is the second live-action/CGI film based on the Sonic video game series.
* The film features several references and Easter eggs to the Sonic video game series.
* Idris Elba's performance as Knuckles was widely praised by critics and fans.

#References

article:
2023 Ukrainian Counteroffensive

The 2023 Ukrainian counteroffensive refers to a series of military operations launched by the Ukrainian Armed Forces in the summer of 2023, with the aim of retaking territory occupied by Russian forces since the start of the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine. The counteroffensive marked a significant turning point in the conflict, as Ukraine sought to regain momentum and push back against Russian advances.

# Background

## State of the war

By the summer of 2023, the war in Ukraine had reached a stalemate, with both sides dug in along a 600-mile front line. Russian forces had made significant gains in the east and south, but Ukrainian resistance had prevented them from achieving a decisive victory. The Ukrainian military had been working to rebuild and rearm, with significant support from Western countries, and was now poised to launch a counterattack.

## Russian defenses

Russian forces had established a network of defensive lines and fortifications, including minefields, trenches, and artillery emplacements. These defenses were designed to slow down a Ukrainian advance and allow Russian troops to regroup and counterattack. However, Ukrainian military planners believed that they had identified weaknesses in the Russian defenses that could be exploited.

# Prelude

## Planning

Ukrainian military planners had been working on a counteroffensive strategy for several months, using intelligence gathered from reconnaissance missions, satellite imagery, and other sources. The plan involved a coordinated attack on multiple fronts, with the aim of breaking through Russian defenses and retaking key territory.

## Shaping operations

In the weeks leading up to the counteroffensive, Ukrainian forces conducted a series of shaping operations, designed to weaken Russian defenses and create opportunities for a breakthrough. These operations included artillery strikes, drone attacks, and special forces raids, all aimed at disrupting Russian supply lines and command structures.

# Counteroffensive

## Start date

The Ukrainian counteroffensive began on June 4, 2023, with a series of coordinated attacks on Russian positions along the front line. The attacks were launched simultaneously on multiple fronts, catching Russian forces off guard and forcing them to respond quickly to the new threat.

## Southern front

### Melitopol direction

In the south, Ukrainian forces launched a major attack on the city of Melitopol, which had been occupied by Russian troops since the start of the war. The attack was led by the Ukrainian 35th Marine Brigade, which fought its way through Russian defenses and entered the city on June 6.

### Berdiansk direction: Staromaiorske-Urozhaine

Meanwhile, Ukrainian forces also launched an attack on the Berdiansk direction, with the aim of retaking the town of Staromaiorske and the surrounding area. The attack was successful, and Ukrainian troops were able to establish a foothold in the area.

## Eastern front

### Donetsk Oblast

On the eastern front, Ukrainian forces launched a series of attacks on Russian positions in the Donetsk Oblast, with the aim of retaking key territory and pushing back Russian advances. The attacks were successful, and Ukrainian troops were able to make significant gains in the area.

## Dnieper front

In the Dnieper region, Ukrainian forces launched a series of attacks on Russian positions along the river, with the aim of retaking key territory and disrupting Russian supply lines. The attacks were successful, and Ukrainian troops were able to establish a foothold in the area.

## Behind front lines

### Crimea and the Black Sea

Meanwhile, Ukrainian forces also launched a series of attacks on Russian positions in Crimea and the Black Sea, with the aim of disrupting Russian supply lines and command structures. The attacks were successful, and Ukrainian troops were able to establish a foothold in the area.

### Other areas

Ukrainian forces also launched attacks on Russian positions in other areas, including the Kharkiv and Sumy regions. The attacks were successful, and Ukrainian troops were able to make significant gains in the area.

## Result

The Ukrainian counteroffensive was successful, with Ukrainian troops able to retake significant territory and push back Russian advances. The counteroffensive marked a significant turning point in the conflict, as Ukraine regained momentum and began to push back against Russian forces.

# Strengths

## Personnel

The Ukrainian military had a significant advantage in terms of personnel, with a large and well-trained army that was able to launch a coordinated attack on multiple fronts. Ukrainian troops were highly motivated and well-led, with a strong sense of purpose and a determination to retake their country.

## Equipment

The Ukrainian military also had a significant advantage in terms of equipment, with a large arsenal of artillery, tanks, and other military hardware. Ukrainian troops were well-equipped and well-supplied, with a strong logistics system that allowed them to maintain a high tempo of operations.

# Casualties and losses

## Ukraine

Ukrainian forces suffered significant casualties during the counteroffensive, with estimates suggesting that hundreds of troops were killed or wounded. However, the Ukrainian military was able to absorb these losses and continue to push forward.

## Russia

Russian forces also suffered significant casualties during the counteroffensive, with estimates suggesting that thousands of troops were killed or wounded. The Russian military was forced to withdraw from several key areas, and its ability to launch a counterattack was severely limited.

# Analysis

## Timeframe and progression

The Ukrainian counteroffensive was a complex and multifaceted operation that involved a coordinated attack on multiple fronts. The operation was carefully planned and executed, with Ukrainian troops making significant gains in the first few weeks of the counteroffensive.

## Significance and goals

The Ukrainian counteroffensive was a significant turning point in the conflict, as Ukraine regained momentum and began to push back against Russian forces. The counteroffensive marked a major shift in the balance of power, with Ukrainian troops able to retake significant territory and disrupt Russian supply lines.

### Concerns

However, there were also concerns about the sustainability of the Ukrainian counteroffensive, with some analysts warning that Ukrainian troops were overextended and vulnerable to a Russian counterattack. There were also concerns about the humanitarian impact of the conflict, with thousands of civilians caught in the crossfire.

## Tactics and equipment

### Russian minefields and fortifications

Russian forces had established a network of minefields and fortifications, including trenches, bunkers, and artillery emplacements. These defenses were designed to slow down a Ukrainian advance and allow Russian troops to regroup and counterattack.

### Artillery and aerial warfare

Ukrainian forces made significant use of artillery and aerial warfare during the counteroffensive, with a large arsenal of artillery and airpower that allowed them to pound Russian positions and disrupt their supply lines.

### Other tactics and equipment

Ukrainian forces also made use of other tactics and equipment, including drones, special forces, and electronic warfare. These tactics allowed Ukrainian troops to gather intelligence, disrupt Russian communications, and launch surprise attacks on Russian positions.

## Russian command

### Structure

The Russian military command structure was complex and bureaucratic, with a large and slow-moving chain of command that made it difficult to respond quickly to changing circumstances.

### Issues

There were also issues with Russian command, including a lack of coordination and communication between different units and a failure to adapt to changing circumstances. These issues allowed Ukrainian troops to exploit weaknesses in the Russian defenses and launch a successful counterattack.

# Early reactions

## Governmental

The Ukrainian government hailed the counteroffensive as a major success, with President Volodymyr Zelensky praising the bravery and determination of Ukrainian troops. The Russian government, on the other hand, was more subdued, with President Vladimir Putin acknowledging that Ukrainian troops had made gains but insisting that the Russian military was still in control.

## Russian information space and milbloggers

The Russian information space was filled with contradictory reports and claims, with some milbloggers and analysts praising the Russian military's performance while others criticized its failures. There were also reports of Russian troops being withdrawn from the front line and redeployed to other areas.

article:
Typhoon Hinnamnor

Typhoon Hinnamnor was a powerful tropical cyclone that affected several countries in East Asia, particularly Japan and South Korea, in September 2022. The 11th named storm of the 2022 Pacific typhoon season, Hinnamnor was a large and intense typhoon that brought strong winds, heavy rainfall, and significant damage to the regions it affected.

# Meteorological history

Typhoon Hinnamnor formed on August 28, 2022, as a tropical depression in the western Pacific Ocean, approximately 1,000 km (620 miles) southeast of the Japanese island of Okinawa. The system gradually intensified, becoming a tropical storm on August 30 and a typhoon on September 1. Hinnamnor rapidly intensified over the next few days, reaching its peak intensity on September 4 as a Category 5-equivalent super typhoon with maximum sustained winds of 250 km/h (155 mph) and a minimum central pressure of 920 hPa (27.17 inHg).

After reaching its peak intensity, Hinnamnor began to slowly weaken as it approached the Ryukyu Islands, Japan. The typhoon made landfall on the island of Kyushu on September 6, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall to the region. Hinnamnor then moved northward, passing through the Korea Strait and making landfall on the southern coast of South Korea on September 7.

# Preparations

## Japan

In anticipation of Typhoon Hinnamnor's landfall, the Japanese government issued a series of warnings and advisories, including a typhoon warning for the Ryukyu Islands and a heavy rainfall warning for the Kyushu region. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) warned of the potential for strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surges, and advised residents to take necessary precautions.

The Japanese government also took steps to prepare for the typhoon, including evacuating residents from low-lying areas and deploying emergency responders to affected regions. The country's transportation systems, including airports and train lines, were also shut down or reduced in preparation for the storm.

## South Korea

In South Korea, the government issued a series of alerts and warnings, including a typhoon alert for the southern coast and a heavy rainfall warning for the Jeju Island. The Korea Meteorological Administration (KMA) warned of the potential for strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surges, and advised residents to take necessary precautions.

The South Korean government also took steps to prepare for the typhoon, including evacuating residents from low-lying areas and deploying emergency responders to affected regions. The country's transportation systems, including airports and train lines, were also shut down or reduced in preparation for the storm.

## Elsewhere

In addition to Japan and South Korea, other countries in the region, including Taiwan and the Philippines, also issued warnings and advisories in anticipation of Typhoon Hinnamnor's approach.

# Impact

## Japan

Typhoon Hinnamnor brought significant damage and disruption to Japan, particularly in the Kyushu region. The storm's strong winds and heavy rainfall caused widespread power outages, with over 100,000 households left without electricity. The storm also caused significant damage to buildings and infrastructure, including the collapse of a highway bridge in the city of Fukuoka.

The storm's heavy rainfall also caused significant flooding, particularly in the city of Sasebo, where over 1,000 residents were evacuated due to rising floodwaters. The city's port was also closed due to the storm, with several ships damaged or sunk.

## South Korea

In South Korea, Typhoon Hinnamnor brought significant damage and disruption, particularly in the southern coast. The storm's strong winds and heavy rainfall caused widespread power outages, with over 50,000 households left without electricity. The storm also caused significant damage to buildings and infrastructure, including the collapse of a highway overpass in the city of Busan.

The storm's heavy rainfall also caused significant flooding, particularly in the city of Pohang, where over 500 residents were evacuated due to rising floodwaters. The city's port was also closed due to the storm, with several ships damaged or sunk.

## Elsewhere

In addition to Japan and South Korea, other countries in the region, including Taiwan and the Philippines, also reported damage and disruption from Typhoon Hinnamnor. However, the storm's impact was generally less severe in these countries, with no reports of significant damage or casualties.

# Retirement

Due to the significant damage and disruption caused by Typhoon Hinnamnor, the name "Hinnamnor" was retired from the list of tropical cyclone names in the western Pacific Ocean. The name was replaced by "Hinamnor", which will be used for future tropical cyclones in the region.

2022 The Hundred Season

The 2022 season of The Hundred was the second edition of the Hundred, a professional franchise 100-ball cricket tournament in England and Wales. The tournament featured eight teams, with each team playing a series of group-stage matches, followed by knockout stages to determine the champions.

#Teams

The eight teams that competed in the 2022 season of The Hundred were:

* Birmingham Phoenix
* London Spirit
* Manchester Originals
* Northern Superchargers
* Oval Invincibles
* Southern Brave
* Trent Rockets
* Welsh Fire

Each team had a men's and women's squad, with players selected through a combination of retention, draft, and auction.

#Tournament structure

The tournament structure for the 2022 season of The Hundred consisted of a group stage, followed by knockout stages. Each team played eight group-stage matches, with the top three teams in each group progressing to the knockout stages. The knockout stages consisted of an eliminator match and a final, with the winner of the final being crowned the champion.

2022 NHL Entry Draft

The 2022 NHL Entry Draft was the 60th NHL Entry Draft, held on July 7-8, 2022, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec. The draft was originally scheduled to take place on June 24-25, 2022, but was postponed due to the 2021-22 NHL season's schedule being affected by the COVID-19 pandemic.

# Eligibility

The eligibility rules for the 2022 NHL Entry Draft were as follows:

* Players born between January 1, 2002, and September 15, 2004, were eligible for selection.
* Players who were not drafted in the 2020 NHL Entry Draft and were born after June 30, 2002, were also eligible.
* Undrafted, non-North American players over the age of 20 were eligible for selection.

# Draft lottery

The 2022 NHL Draft Lottery was held on May 10, 2022, to determine the top two picks in the draft. The lottery was won by the Montreal Canadiens, who selected first overall. The New Jersey Devils won the second lottery drawing and selected second overall. The remaining teams were assigned picks based on their finish in the 2021-22 NHL season.

Several players were considered top prospects for the 2022 NHL Entry Draft. Some of the most notable prospects included:

The qualifying times were set by FINA, and they varied depending on the event and the swimmer's age group.

2022 United States Elections

The 2022 United States elections were held on November 8, 2022, with various federal, state, and local elections taking place across the country. These elections were considered a crucial test for the Democratic Party, which had controlled both the White House and Congress since the 2020 elections. The elections saw a significant shift in the balance of power, with the Republican Party making gains in the House of Representatives and the Senate.

Background

The 2022 elections took place against the backdrop of a polarized national environment, with rising inflation, ongoing debates over abortion and gun control, and concerns about the integrity of American democracy. The COVID-19 pandemic had receded from its peak, but its impact on the economy and public health continued to be felt. The presidency of Joe Biden, who had taken office in 2021, was also a major factor in the elections, with his policies and performance being closely scrutinized by voters.

Campaign

The 2022 campaign season saw a high level of intensity and investment, with both parties and their supporters spending vast sums of money on advertising, voter mobilization, and other campaign activities. The campaign also saw a surge in early voting and mail-in ballots, which reflected changes in voting patterns brought about by the pandemic.

Primaries

The primary season for the 2022 elections began in February 2022 and lasted until September 2022. During this period, both parties held contests in various states to select their nominees for the general elections. The primary season saw several notable contests, including the Republican primary in Pennsylvania, where Dr. Mehmet Oz won the nomination for the Senate, and the Democratic primary in Texas, where Beto O'Rourke won the nomination for governor.

Issues

The 2022 campaign was dominated by a range of issues, including the economy, abortion, crime and gun violence, democracy, education, climate change, immigration, student loan forgiveness, and the presidency of Joe Biden.

Economy

The economy was a major issue in the 2022 elections, with rising inflation and concerns about economic growth dominating the debate. The Biden administration's handling of the economy was a key point of contention, with Republicans arguing that its policies had led to higher prices and slower growth.

Abortion

Abortion was another highly contentious issue in the 2022 elections, following the Supreme Court's decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization, which overturned the constitutional right to abortion established in Roe v. Wade. The decision sparked widespread protests and calls for action from pro-choice groups, while anti-abortion groups celebrated the ruling as a major victory.

Crime and gun violence

Crime and gun violence were also major issues in the 2022 elections, with concerns about public safety and the need for stricter gun control laws dominating the debate. The Biden administration's efforts to address these issues, including its support for universal background checks and red flag laws, were opposed by many Republicans, who argued that such measures would infringe on Second Amendment rights.

Democracy

The integrity of American democracy was another key issue in the 2022 elections, with concerns about voter suppression, election security, and the spread of misinformation dominating the debate. The Biden administration's efforts to address these issues, including its support for the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act and the Electoral Count Reform Act, were opposed by many Republicans, who argued that such measures would undermine the integrity of the electoral process.

Education

Education was also a major issue in the 2022 elections, with concerns about the quality of public education and the need for increased funding dominating the debate. The Biden administration's efforts to address these issues, including its support for universal pre-K and student loan forgiveness, were opposed by many Republicans, who argued that such measures would be too costly and ineffective.

Climate change

Climate change was another key issue in the 2022 elections, with concerns about the need for urgent action to address this global crisis dominating the debate. The Biden administration's efforts to address this issue, including its support for the Paris Agreement and its efforts to promote clean energy, were opposed by many Republicans, who argued that such measures would be too costly and ineffective.

Immigration

Student loan forgiveness

The Biden administration's efforts to address this issue, including its support for student loan forgiveness and its efforts to make college more affordable, were opposed by many Republicans, who argued that such measures would be too costly and ineffective.

Presidency of Joe Biden

The presidency of Joe Biden was also a major issue in the 2022 elections, with his policies and performance being closely scrutinized by voters. The Biden administration's handling of the economy, its response to the COVID-19 pandemic, and its efforts to address various domestic and foreign policy issues were all major points of contention in the campaign.

Russian invasion of Ukraine

The Russian invasion of Ukraine was also a major issue in the 2022 elections, with concerns about the need for American leadership in response to this crisis dominating the debate. The Biden administration's efforts to address this issue, including its support for Ukraine and its efforts to impose sanctions on Russia, were opposed by many Republicans, who argued that such measures would be too weak and ineffective.

article:
Edwards Vacuum

Edwards Vacuum is a leading global provider of vacuum and abatement solutions for various industries, including semiconductor, pharmaceutical, and scientific research. With a rich history spanning over a century, the company has undergone significant transformations, adapting to changing market demands and technological advancements.

# History

## Independent (1919-1967)

Edwards Vacuum was founded in 1919 by F.D. Edwards in the United Kingdom. Initially, the company focused on developing and manufacturing vacuum pumps and other related equipment. During the 1920s and 1930s, Edwards Vacuum experienced significant growth, expanding its product line and establishing a strong presence in the UK and European markets. The company's innovative approach to vacuum technology led to the development of the first rotary pump, which became a benchmark for the industry.

## BOC (1968-2006)

In 1968, Edwards Vacuum was acquired by the British Oxygen Company (BOC), a leading industrial gases and equipment provider. Under BOC's ownership, Edwards Vacuum continued to expand its operations, investing in research and development, and introducing new products to the market. The company's expertise in vacuum technology was further leveraged through the development of new applications, such as vacuum furnaces and freeze dryers.

## Linde and CCMP Capital (2006-2014)

In 2006, BOC was acquired by Linde AG, a German-based industrial gases and engineering company. As part of the acquisition, Edwards Vacuum became a subsidiary of Linde's semiconductor and solar business segment. In 2007, CCMP Capital, a private equity firm, acquired a majority stake in Edwards Vacuum from Linde. During this period, the company continued to invest in research and development, expanding its product portfolio and strengthening its global presence.

## Atlas Copco (2014-present)

In 2014, Atlas Copco, a Swedish-based industrial equipment manufacturer, acquired Edwards Vacuum from CCMP Capital. The acquisition marked a significant milestone in Edwards Vacuum's history, as the company became part of a global leader in the industrial equipment sector. Under Atlas Copco's ownership, Edwards Vacuum has continued to invest in research and development, expanding its product portfolio and strengthening its global presence.

# Products and markets

## 1950-60s

During the 1950s and 1960s, Edwards Vacuum focused on developing and manufacturing vacuum pumps and other related equipment for the scientific research and industrial sectors. The company's innovative approach to vacuum technology led to the development of new products, including the first diffusion pump and the first ion pump.

## 1970s

In the 1970s, Edwards Vacuum expanded its product portfolio to include vacuum furnaces and freeze dryers. The company's expertise in vacuum technology was further leveraged through the development of new applications, such as vacuum deposition and vacuum coating.

## 1980s

During the 1980s, Edwards Vacuum continued to invest in research and development, introducing new products to the market, including the first turbomolecular pump and the first cryogenic pump. The company's expertise in vacuum technology was further leveraged through the development of new applications, such as vacuum plasma etching and vacuum ion implantation.

## 1990s

In the 1990s, Edwards Vacuum expanded its product portfolio to include abatement solutions for the semiconductor and pharmaceutical industries. The company's expertise in vacuum technology was further leverenced through the development of new applications, such as vacuum-based chemical vapor deposition and vacuum-based physical vapor deposition.

## Recent

In recent years, Edwards Vacuum has continued to invest in research and development, expanding its product portfolio to include new applications, such as vacuum-based biotechnology and vacuum-based nanotechnology. The company's expertise in vacuum technology has been further leverenced through the development of new products, including the first dry scroll pump and the first oil-free diaphragm pump.

# Edwards Lecture Series

The Edwards Lecture Series is an annual event hosted by Edwards Vacuum, featuring presentations from leading experts in the fields of vacuum technology and abatement solutions. The event is designed to promote knowledge sharing and collaboration among industry professionals, academics, and researchers. The lecture series has become a prominent platform for discussing the latest advancements and trends in the field, and has featured presentations from renowned experts in the industry.

# Controversies

## Domain registration

In 2013, Edwards Vacuum was involved in a controversy surrounding the registration of the domain name "edwardsvacuum.com". The company claimed that the domain name was registered by a third party in bad faith, and sought to recover the domain through the World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) Arbitration and Mediation Center. The dispute was eventually resolved in favor of Edwards Vacuum, with the domain name being transferred to the company.

## Hoffman Instrumentation Supply Inc

In 2019, Edwards Vacuum was involved in a controversy surrounding a lawsuit filed by Hoffman Instrumentation Supply Inc, a US-based company that specializes in the supply of vacuum equipment and instrumentation. The lawsuit alleged that Edwards Vacuum had engaged in unfair business practices, including the theft of trade secrets and the misappropriation of confidential information. The lawsuit was eventually settled out of court, with the terms of the settlement remaining confidential.

John (given name)

John is a masculine given name that originated from the Hebrew name "Yochanan", meaning "God is gracious". It is one of the most popular and enduring given names in the world, with numerous variations and derivatives across different cultures and languages.

#Origins

The name John is derived from the Hebrew name "Yochanan", which is composed of two elements: "Yo" meaning "God" and "chanan" meaning "is gracious". The name was originally given to the son of Zechariah and Elizabeth in the New Testament, who was destined to become the prophet and baptizer of Jesus Christ.

##Germanic derivatives

The name John was introduced to Europe by the Normans and was adapted into various Germanic languages. In Old English, the name was spelled "Iohannes", which was later modified to "John". The name was also influenced by the Old Norse name "Jón", which was derived from the Old English name. In Dutch, the name is spelled "Jan", while in German, it is spelled "Johann" or "Johan".

#Name statistics

John is one of the most popular given names in the world, with numerous variations and derivatives. According to the United States Census Bureau, John was the most popular boy name in the United States from 1880 to 1923, and remained in the top 10 most popular boy names until 1986. In the United Kingdom, John was the most popular boy name from 1954 to 1964, and remained in the top 10 most popular boy names until 1994.

article:
The Little Mermaid (2023 film)

The Little Mermaid is a 2023 American musical fantasy film directed by Rob Marshall and written by Jane Goldman, from a story by Marshall, Goldman, and David Magee. It is a live-action adaptation of the 1989 animated Disney film of the same name, which was itself based on the 1837 Danish fairy tale of the same name by Hans Christian Andersen. The film stars Halle Bailey as Ariel, a young mermaid who dreams of exploring the world above the sea, and Melissa McCarthy as Ursula, the sea witch who seeks to overthrow King Triton and rule the ocean.

#Plot

The film follows the story of Ariel, a young mermaid who lives under the sea with her father, King Triton, and her six older sisters. Ariel is fascinated by the world above the sea and longs to explore it. One day, she falls in love with Prince Eric, a human who has been shipwrecked on her father's kingdom. Ariel makes a deal with Ursula, the sea witch, to trade her voice for a pair of legs, allowing her to go on land to meet Eric.

However, Ursula has her own motives and plans to use Ariel's voice to seduce Eric and marry him herself, which would allow her to rule the ocean. Meanwhile, Ariel must navigate the complexities of human life and win Eric's heart, all while trying to thwart Ursula's plans and save her father's kingdom.

#Cast

* Halle Bailey as Ariel
* Melissa McCarthy as Ursula
* Jacob Tremblay as Flounder
* Awkwafina as Scuttle
* Jonah Hauer-King as Prince Eric
* Noma Dumezweni as Queen Athena
* Javier Bardem as King Triton
* Daveed Diggs as Sebastian
* Art Malik as Grimsby
* Emily Coates as Vanessa

#Production

##Development

In 2016, it was announced that Disney was developing a live-action remake of The Little Mermaid, with Lin-Manuel Miranda set to write the music and Rob Marshall set to direct. However, due to creative differences, Miranda left the project in 2018, and Jane Goldman was brought in to rewrite the script.

##Casting

In 2019, it was announced that Halle Bailey had been cast as Ariel, following a worldwide search for the role. Melissa McCarthy was cast as Ursula in 2020, and the rest of the cast was announced shortly after.

##Filming

Principal photography began in March 2021 and wrapped in July 2022. The film was shot on location in Sardinia, Italy, and at Pinewood Studios in London.

##Visual effects

The film's visual effects were created by Industrial Light & Magic, who worked closely with the production team to bring the underwater world to life. The film's CGI characters, including Flounder and Scuttle, were designed and animated by the visual effects team.

###Lawsuit

In 2022, it was reported that a lawsuit had been filed against Disney by a former employee of Industrial Light & Magic, who claimed that they had been fired after speaking out about the film's visual effects budget. The lawsuit alleged that the budget had been severely cut, resulting in a inferior product.

#Music

The film's soundtrack was composed by Alan Menken, who also wrote the music for the 1989 animated film. The soundtrack features new versions of classic songs, including "Part of Your World" and "Under the Sea", as well as new songs written by Menken and David Zippel.

#Release

##Marketing

The film's marketing campaign began in 2022, with the release of a teaser trailer. The trailer was met with widespread excitement, with many fans praising Bailey's performance as Ariel.

##Home media

The film was released on Blu-ray and DVD in November 2023, and is also available to stream on Disney+.

#Reception

##Pre-release

The film received widespread attention and anticipation in the months leading up to its release. Many fans were excited to see the live-action adaptation of the beloved animated film, and Bailey's casting as Ariel was widely praised.

##Box office

The film was released in theaters in May 2023 and was a commercial success, grossing over $500 million worldwide.

##Critical response

The film received mixed reviews from critics, with some praising Bailey's performance and the film's visuals, while others criticized the film's pacing and plot.

##Controversies

The film was met with some controversy, with some critics accusing the film of whitewashing the character of Prince Eric. Others criticized the film's handling of Ursula's character, accusing the film of perpetuating negative stereotypes about overweight women.

##Accolades

The film received several awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Original Song at the 2024 Academy Awards.

#In other media

##Printed adaptations

The film was adapted into a novelization by Matt Forbeck, which was released in May 2023.

##Spin-off television series

In 2023, it was announced that a spin-off television series, titled "The Little Mermaid: Ariel's Beginning", was in development. The series will explore Ariel's life before the events of the film and will feature Bailey reprising her role as Ariel.

#Future

A sequel to the film is reportedly in development, with Bailey set to reprise her role as Ariel. However, no official release date has been announced.

#References

article:
2022 WDF World Darts Championship

The 2022 WDF World Darts Championship was the first edition of the WDF World Darts Championship, a major international darts tournament organized by the World Darts Federation (WDF). The event took place from April 2 to April 10, 2022, at the Lakeside Country Club in Frimley Green, Surrey, England.

#Prize money

The total prize fund for the 2022 WDF World Darts Championship was £300,000, with the men's champion receiving £50,000 and the women's champion receiving £25,000. The breakdown of the prize fund was as follows:

* Men's:
	+ Winner: £50,000
	+ Runner-up: £20,000
	+ Semi-finalists: £10,000
	+ Quarter-finalists: £5,000
	+ Last 16: £2,500
	+ Last 32: £1,250
	+ Last 64: £500
* Women's:
	+ Winner: £25,000
	+ Runner-up: £10,000
	+ Semi-finalists: £5,000
	+ Quarter-finalists: £2,500
	+ Last 16: £1,250
	+ Last 32: £500
* Boys' and Girls':
	+ Winner: £2,000
	+ Runner-up: £1,000
	+ Semi-finalists: £500
	+ Quarter-finalists: £250

#Schedule

The 2022 WDF World Darts Championship took place over nine days, from April 2 to April 10, 2022. The schedule was as follows:

* April 2: Men's and women's preliminary rounds
* April 3-4: Men's and women's last 64
* April 5-6: Men's and women's last 32
* April 7: Men's and women's last 16
* April 8: Men's and women's quarter-finals
* April 9: Men's and women's semi-finals
* April 10: Men's and women's finals

#Men's

##Format and qualifiers

The men's competition featured 128 players from around the world. The top 16 seeds were determined by the WDF world rankings, while the remaining players were determined by a combination of WDF world rankings and national qualifying events.

##Draw

###Finals

The men's final took place on April 10, 2022, with Andy Baetens of Belgium defeating Mark Barilli of England 7-4 in the final.

###Rounds 1-4

The men's competition began with the preliminary rounds on April 2, 2022. The top 16 seeds entered the competition in the last 64, which took place on April 3-4. The last 32 took place on April 5-6, followed by the last 16 on April 7. The quarter-finals took place on April 8, with the semi-finals on April 9.

#Women's

##Format and qualifiers

The women's competition featured 64 players from around the world. The top 8 seeds were determined by the WDF world rankings, while the remaining players were determined by a combination of WDF world rankings and national qualifying events.

##Draw

The women's final took place on April 10, 2022, with Beau Greaves of England defeating Kirsty Hutchinson of Scotland 7-4 in the final.

#Boys'

##Format and qualifiers

The boys' competition featured 32 players from around the world, with the top 8 seeds determined by the WDF youth rankings. The remaining players were determined by national qualifying events.

##Draw

The boys' final took place on April 9, 2022, with Charlie Large of England defeating Leighton Bennett of England 4-2 in the final.

#Girls'

##Format and qualifiers

The girls' competition featured 16 players from around the world, with the top 4 seeds determined by the WDF youth rankings. The remaining players were determined by national qualifying events.

##Draw

The girls' final took place on April 9, 2022, with Sophie Grønlund of Denmark defeating Wibke Riemann of Germany 4-2 in the final.

#Statistics

A total of 10 countries were represented in the girls' competition.

article:
Pathaan (film)

Pathaan is a 2023 Indian Hindi-language action thriller film directed by Siddharth Anand and written by Shridhar Raghavan and Abbas Tyrewala. The film is produced by Aditya Chopra under the banner of Yash Raj Films (YRF). Pathaan marks the fourth installment in the YRF Spy Universe and stars Shah Rukh Khan, Deepika Padukone, and John Abraham in the lead roles.

# Plot

The film follows the story of Pathaan (Shah Rukh Khan), a former Indian army officer who is recruited by the Research and Analysis Wing (R&AW) to take down a rogue agent named Jim (John Abraham). Jim, a former ISI agent, has stolen a deadly virus that has the potential to wipe out the entire population of India. Pathaan must use his skills and resources to track down Jim and retrieve the virus before it falls into the wrong hands. Along the way, he is aided by Rubina (Deepika Padukone), a Pakistani ISI agent who has her own reasons for wanting to take down Jim.

As Pathaan navigates the complex web of international espionage, he must confront his own demons and make difficult choices to save the country from the brink of disaster. The film is a high-octane action thriller with plenty of twists and turns, keeping the audience on the edge of their seats.

# Cast

* Shah Rukh Khan as Pathaan
* Deepika Padukone as Rubina
* John Abraham as Jim
* Dimple Kapadia as Nandini
* Ashutosh Rana as Colonel Sunil Luthra
* Gautam Rode as Ravi
* Shaji Choudhary as Abdul

# Production

## Development

The development of Pathaan began in 2019, when Siddharth Anand approached Aditya Chopra with the idea of making a spy thriller. Chopra was impressed with the script and greenlit the project. The film was initially set to release in 2022, but due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the release date was pushed back to 2023.

## Casting

Shah Rukh Khan was the first actor to be cast in the film, followed by Deepika Padukone and John Abraham. The cast underwent extensive training to prepare for their roles, including physical training and stunt rehearsals.

## Filming

Principal photography for Pathaan began in November 2020 and wrapped up in June 2022. The film was shot on location in India, Spain, and the United Arab Emirates. The action sequences were filmed in various locations, including the Pyrenees mountains in Spain and the desert landscapes of Dubai.

# Music

The music for Pathaan was composed by Vishal-Shekhar, with lyrics by Kumaar and Vishal Dadlani. The soundtrack features five songs, including the hit single "Besharam Rang," which was released in December 2022. The song features Shah Rukh Khan and Deepika Padukone in a romantic dance sequence, set against the backdrop of the Spanish countryside.

# Controversy

Pathaan was embroiled in controversy in December 2022, when the song "Besharam Rang" sparked outrage among some sections of the Indian population. The song's lyrics and visuals were deemed objectionable by some, who claimed that they were anti-Hindu and anti-Indian. The controversy led to the film's trailer being banned in some states, and the filmmakers were forced to make changes to the song.

# Marketing

The marketing campaign for Pathaan began in October 2022, with the release of the film's first teaser. The teaser featured Shah Rukh Khan in a dramatic action sequence, set against the backdrop of a desert landscape. The film's trailer was released in December 2022, and it quickly went viral on social media.

# Release

## Theatrical

Pathaan was released in theaters on January 25, 2023, in India and worldwide. The film received a wide release, with over 5,000 screens in India alone.

## Home media

Pathaan will be available on Amazon Prime Video in March 2023, as part of a deal between Yash Raj Films and the streaming platform.

# Reception

## Critical response

### India

Pathaan received mixed reviews from Indian critics, with some praising the film's action sequences and performances, while others criticized its storyline and pacing. The Times of India gave the film 3.5 out of 5 stars, praising Shah Rukh Khan's performance and the film's action sequences. The Hindu gave the film 2.5 out of 5 stars, criticizing its storyline and pacing.

### International

Pathaan received positive reviews from international critics, with many praising the film's action sequences and performances. The Hollywood Reporter gave the film a positive review, praising Shah Rukh Khan's performance and the film's action sequences. Variety gave the film a positive review, praising the film's visuals and action sequences.

## Box office

Pathaan was a commercial success at the box office, grossing over ₹1,000 crore (US$130 million) worldwide. The film broke several box office records, including the highest opening day collection for a Bollywood film.

# Future

## Pathaan 2

There have been reports of a sequel to Pathaan, with Siddharth Anand and Aditya Chopra set to return as director and producer, respectively. The sequel is expected to go into production in 2024, with Shah Rukh Khan set to reprise his role as Pathaan.

## Tiger vs Pathaan

There have also been reports of a crossover film featuring Pathaan and Tiger, another character from the YRF Spy Universe. The film is expected to go into production in 2025, with Siddharth Anand set to direct.

# Accolades

Pathaan won several awards, including the Filmfare Award for Best Action and the IIFA Award for Best Action.

# Notes

* Pathaan marks the fourth installment in the YRF Spy Universe, following Ek Tha Tiger, Tiger Zinda Hai, and War.
* The film's action sequences were choreographed by Yuen Woo-ping, who is known for his work on films like Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon and The Matrix.
* Pathaan is the highest-grossing film of Shah Rukh Khan's career, surpassing his previous film, Chennai Express.

# References

* "Pathaan". IMDb. Retrieved 2023-02-20.

Football at the 2021 SEA Games – Men's tournament

The men's football tournament at the 2021 Southeast Asian Games was held from 6 to 22 May 2022 in Vietnam. The tournament featured 10 teams from Southeast Asia, competing for the gold medal. This was the 31st edition of the men's football tournament at the SEA Games.

Competition schedule

The tournament was held over a period of 17 days, with the group stage matches taking place from 6 to 16 May 2022. The knockout stage matches were played from 19 to 22 May 2022. The schedule was as follows:

* Group stage: 6-16 May 2022
* Semi-finals: 19 May 2022
* Bronze medal match: 22 May 2022
* Gold medal match: 22 May 2022

Venues

The tournament was held at four venues in Vietnam:

* Mỹ Đình National Stadium, Hanoi
* Việt Trì Stadium, Phú Thọ
* Cẩm Phả Stadium, Quảng Ninh
* Thiên Trường Stadium, Nam Định

Participating nations

Ten teams from Southeast Asia participated in the tournament:

* Cambodia
* Indonesia
* Laos
* Malaysia
* Myanmar
* Philippines
* Singapore
* Thailand
* Timor-Leste
* Vietnam

Draw

The draw for the tournament was held on 6 April 2022 in Hanoi, Vietnam. The teams were divided into two groups of five teams each. The top two teams from each group advanced to the semi-finals.

Squads

Each team was allowed to register a squad of 20 players. The squads were announced before the start of the tournament.

Group stage

The group stage matches were played from 6 to 16 May 2022. The teams were divided into two groups of five teams each. The top two teams from each group advanced to the semi-finals.

Knockout stage

The knockout stage matches were played from 19 to 22 May 2022. The semi-finals were played on 19 May 2022, with the winners advancing to the gold medal match. The losers of the semi-finals played in the bronze medal match on 22 May 2022.

Winners

Vietnam won the gold medal, defeating Thailand 1-0 in the final. Indonesia won the bronze medal, defeating Malaysia 4-3 in a penalty shootout after the match ended 1-1 after extra time.
